path.def: Any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor a Goal (see below) expresses the frame element Path, including directional expressions:   'The bikers crisscrossed through the desert

area.def: This frame element is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path

goal.def: Any expression which tells where the Theme ends up as a result of the motion expresses the frame element Goal

source.def: Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element Source

place.def: The Place is where the motion (which is specified by a Source, Path or Goal) is located

painting.def: A Creator creates an artifact that is typically an iconic Representation of an actual or imagined entity or event

representation.def: The entity that is created to represent either iconically or abstractly

creator.def: An individual or individuals that bring the Representation into existence

place.def: The location in which the Creator produces the Representation

selling.def: These are words describing basic commercial transactions involving a buyer and a seller exchanging money and goods, taking the perspective of the seller

goods.def: The FE Goods is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for Money in a transaction

seller.def: The Seller has possession of the Goods and exchanges them for Money from a Buyer

buyer.def: The Buyer has the Money and wants the Goods

place.def: Where the event takes place

catching.def: A Fuel, some flammable object or substance, ends up on fire

fire.def: The total material currently involved in combustion, including both the parts of the Fuel currently undergoing chemical alteration and the partially ionized gas that results from this process

fuel.def: The entity that is begins to undergo rapid chemical alteration leading to damage or destruction

place.def: This FE identifies the Place where the Fire begins to burn

self_mover.def: Self_mover is the living being which moves under its own power

area.def: Area is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path

direction.def: The direction that the Self_mover heads in during the motion

place.def: The Place is the location within which a defined motion takes place

facing.def: This frame covers words for Body_part(s) (BP) belonging to a Possessor (Poss), which may be characterized by a Descriptor (Desc)

body_part.def: This Frame Element  is the Body_part

lying.def: An Agent supports their body in a particular Location

agent.def: The Agent is the individual whose body is in a particular posture

location.def: A description of the position of the Agent

point_of_contact.def: The part of the body that provides support to the Agent's body in the posture

staring.def: This frame contains perception words whose perceivers intentionally direct their attention to some entity or phenomenon in order to have a perceptual experience

driving.def: The words in this frame describe motion involving a Vehicle and someone who controls it, the Driver

driver.def: This is the being, typically human, that controls the Vehicle as it moves

vehicle.def: This is the means of conveyance controlled by the Driver

path.def: Any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor a Goal expresses the frame element Path

area.def: This frame element is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path

goal.def: Any expression which tells where the moving object(s) ends up as a result of the motion expresses the frame element Goal

place.def: The Place describes the location of a more specific motion (which has Source, Path or Goal)

speaking.def: This frame contains verbs and nouns that communicate the act of a Speaker to address a Message to some Addressee using language

speaker.def: The Speaker is the sentient entity that produces the Message (whether spoken or written)

message.def: The Message is the FE that identifies the content of what the Speaker is communicating to the Addressee

medium.def: Medium is the physical entity or channel used by the Speaker to transmit the statement

topic.def: The Topic is the subject matter to which the Message pertains

place.def: The FE specifies the location where the Message takes place

leaping.def: The Self_mover, a living being, moves under its own direction along a Path

area.def: Area is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path

theme.def: The Theme covers or fills the Location

theme.def: The Theme is the object that changes location during the Placing

goal.def: The FE Goal is the location where the Theme ends up

agent.def: The Agent is the person (or other force) that causes the Theme to move

cause.def: 'Grass , which is sown with clover , provides rich pasture for cattle in summer and the clover is another plant which puts nitrogen into the soil

place.def: The Place indicates where the Placing occurs

theme.def: Theme is the object that moves

goal.def: Goal is any expression that tells where the Theme ends up, or would end up, as a result of the motion

text.def: The entity which results from the act of writing or speaking

lifting.def: An Agent causes a Theme to move from a Source, along a Path, to a Goal

theme.def: The FE Theme is generally an NP Object

agent.def: The Agent is the one whose action causes the motion of a Theme

goal.def: The FE Goal is the point at which the Theme ends up as a result of the motion

path.def: The FE Path is any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor Goal

area.def: The FE Area is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular or not to consist of a single, linear path

place.def: The Place is the general area that provides a setting for a specific motion (with Source, Path, or Goal)

following.def: This frame contains words that necessarily indicate the motion of two distinct objects

theme.def: This is the entity, frequently a living being, which moves in relation to the Cotheme

cotheme.def: This frame element is the second moving object, expressed as a direct object or an oblique:   'Pat accompanied  me down the street

goal.def: Any expression which tells where the Cotheme ends up as a result of the motion expresses the frame element Goal

area.def: Area marks expressions which describe a general area in which the motion of Theme and Cotheme takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path

path.def: Path marks phrases that describe the Theme and Cotheme's trajectory of motion and which are neither expressions of the  Source nor the Goal of motion

place.def: The Place is the location which provides a setting for a defined motion (that is one with Source, Path or Goal)

serving.def: A Helper benefits a Benefited_party by enabling the culmination of a Goal that the Benefited_party has

helper.def: The Helper performs some action that benefits the Benefited_party

benefited_party.def: The Benefited_party receives a benefit from the action of the Helper

goal.def: The desirable state of affairs that the Benefited_party is involved in and which is enabled by the Helper

focal_entity.def: This FE identifies a Focal_entity involved in achieving the Goal

place.def: This FE identifies the Place where the Assistance occurs

shooting.def: An Agent causes a Firearm to discharge which induces the rapid motion of the Projectile

projectile.def: The entity whose rapid, dangerous motion is caused by the Agent and/or Firearm

agent.def: The Agent is the person performing the intentional act causing the motion of the Projectile

place.def: The location in which the shooting event takes place

blowing.def: An Agent causes Air to move in a direction, usually specifying either in or out of the body

agent.def: The Agent's breathing causes the motion of the Air

air.def: Air is the substance that the Agent causes to move

place.def: This FE identifies the Place where the breathing occurs

displaying.def: Generally without overall (translational) motion,  an Agent places a Theme at a location, the Goal, which is profiled

theme.def: The Theme is the object that changes location during the Placing

goal.def: The FE Goal is the location where the Theme ends up

agent.def: The Agent is the person (or other force) that causes the Theme to move

cause.def: 'Grass , which is sown with clover , provides rich pasture for cattle in summer and the clover is another plant which puts nitrogen into the soil

place.def: The Place indicates where the Placing occurs

waving.def: A Theme moves with respect to a Fixed_location, generally with a certain Periodicity, without undergoing unbounded translational motion or significant alteration of configuration/shape

theme.def: A physical entity that is participating in non-translational motion

place.def: The location where the bounded motion happens

drawing.def: A Creator creates an artifact that is typically an iconic Representation of an actual or imagined entity or event

representation.def: The entity that is created to represent either iconically or abstractly

creator.def: An individual or individuals that bring the Representation into existence

place.def: The location in which the Creator produces the Representation

bending.def: An Agent supports their body in a particular Location

agent.def: The Agent is the individual whose body is in a particular posture

location.def: A description of the position of the Agent

point_of_contact.def: The part of the body that provides support to the Agent's body in the posture

digging.def: A Cognizer_agent attempts to find some Sought_entity by examining some Ground

cognizer_agent.def: The person who attempts to find the Sought_entity

sought_entity.def: This is the entity that the Ground may contain

place.def: A spatial setting larger than the Ground in which the Seeking event occurs

crouching.def: A Protagonist changes the overall position and posture of the body

building.def: This frame describes assembly or construction actions, where an Agent joins Components together to form a Created_entity, which is profiled, and hence the object of the verb

created_entity.def: Created_entity identifies the entity that is created in the act of building

agent.def: The Agent builds a Created_entity

components.def: This FE identifies the Components that form the Created_entity

place.def: This FE identifies the Place where the building occurs

opening.def: An Agent manipulates a Fastener to open or close a Containing_object (e

agent.def: The Agent opens/closes the Containing-object

containing_object.def: This FE identifies the item that is closed by the agent with the fastener

container_portal.def: This FE identifies the active zone of the container that may be expressed as the direct object of the target verb

fastener.def: This FE identifies the fastener that the agent manipulates

place.def: The location where the closing event takes place

sticking.def: Generally without overall (translational) motion,  an Agent places a Theme at a location, the Goal, which is profiled

theme.def: The Theme is the object that changes location during the Placing

goal.def: The FE Goal is the location where the Theme ends up

agent.def: The Agent is the person (or other force) that causes the Theme to move

cause.def: 'Grass , which is sown with clover , provides rich pasture for cattle in summer and the clover is another plant which puts nitrogen into the soil

place.def: The Place indicates where the Placing occurs

balancing.def: A Theme has the potential of falling from its current Location, which would likely result in damage

theme.def: A valuable entity which might fall and be damaged

place.def: A particular location in which the Theme is at risk of falling

sharing.def: In this frame Protagonist_1 and Protagonist_2, collectively Protagonists, allow one another to partake jointly the use of an Entity

entity.def: The object that is shared by the Protagonists

protagonists.def: The jointly expressed participants in the use of the Entity

protagonist_1.def: The participant that is encoded as the subject of an active-form sentence or as a by-PP in a passive, who partakes in the joint usage of the Entity

protagonist_2.def: The participant in the reciprocal event that is coded in a with-PP, who partakes in the usage of the Entity along with Protagonist_1

place.def: The location where the Protagonists partake jointly in the use of the Entity

conversing.def: A group of people (the Interlocutors or Interlocutor_1 and Interlocutor_2 together) have a conversation

interlocutors.def: The group of individuals involved in chatting

interlocutor_1.def: The individual or individuals that form the more prominent (i

interlocutor_2.def: The semantically (and grammatically) less prominent group of participants in a conversation

place.def: The location where a chat takes place

skateboarding.def: An Agent is performing the portion of an Activity in which there is dynamic stability

agent.def: The Agent engages in an ongoing Activity

activity.def: This FE identifies the name of the ongoing Activity in which an Agent engages

place.def: This FE identifies the Place where the ongoing Activity occurs

tying.def: The Attaching frame covers two situations: a scene in which somebody causes one thing to be physically connected to something else; or a scene in which somebody causes two things to be connected to each other

agent.def: The Agent manipulates an object

goal.def: Goal identifies the location to which an Item is attached

item.def: This FE identifies the Item that the Agent attaches to the Goal

connector.def: The Connector forms the bond that maintains the Item or Items in a fixed position; it is usually expressed in a with-PP

items.def: This FE identifies the plural Items that are tied together, resulting in their mutual attachment

place.def: This FE identifies the Place where the Agent intentionally affects an Item or Items

wrapping.def: This frame refers to clothing and its characteristics,  including anything that people conventionally wear

garment.def: This FE identifes the clothing worn

rolling.def: A Theme moves with respect to a Fixed_location, generally with a certain Periodicity, without undergoing unbounded translational motion or significant alteration of configuration/shape

theme.def: A physical entity that is participating in non-translational motion

place.def: The location where the bounded motion happens

buying.def: These are words describing a basic commercial transaction involving a Buyer and a Seller exchanging Money and Goods, taking the perspective of the Buyer

goods.def: The FE Goods is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for Money in a transaction

buyer.def: The Buyer wants the Goods and offers Money to a Seller in exchange for them

place.def: Where the event takes place

shopping.def: A Shopper looks for Goods in order to purchase them

shopper.def: The person who attempts to find the Goods

goods.def: This is the entity that the Ground may contain

place.def: A spatial setting larger than the Ground in which the Shopping event occurs

leaving.def: An object (the Theme) moves away from a Source

theme.def: This is the object which moves

source.def: All the verbs in this frame express some change of location, away from one place and to another

place.def: The Place is the location in which the departing takes place

decorating.def: A Location is filled or covered with the Theme

theme.def: The Theme covers or fills the Location

location.def: Location is the object or area that the Theme fills or covers

operating.def: An Operator manipulates the substructure of a System such that the System performs the function it was created for

operator.def: The invididual who manipulates the substructure of the System

system.def: The entity that  the Operator gets to perform its intended function

place.def: This FE identifies the place where the Operator runs the System

floating.def: Some entity (Theme) starts out in one place (Source) and ends up in some other place (Goal), having covered some space between the two (Path)

theme.def: The Theme is the entity that changes location

path.def: The Path refers to (a part of) the ground over which the Theme travels  or to a landmark by which the Theme travels

goal.def: The Goal is the location the Theme ends up in

area.def: Area identifies the setting in which the Theme's movement takes place without a specified Path

source.def: The Source is the location the Theme occupies initially before its change of location

place.def: The Place is the general area in which a specific motion (with Source, Path, or Goal) occurs

hiking.def: The Self_mover, a living being, moves under its own direction along a Path

self_mover.def: Self_mover is the living being which moves under its own power

path.def: Path is used for any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor a Goal

area.def: Area is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path

goal.def: Goal is used for any expression which tells where the Self_mover ends up as a result of the motion

direction.def: The direction that the Self_mover heads in during the motion

place.def: The Place is the location within which a defined motion takes place

heading.def: The Self_mover, a living being, moves under its own direction along a Path

self_mover.def: Self_mover is the living being which moves under its own power

direction.def: The direction that the Self_mover heads in during the motion

place.def: The Place is the location within which a defined motion takes place

inspecting.def: An Inspector directs his/her perceptual attention to a Ground to ascertain whether the Ground is intact or  whether an Unwanted_entity is present

ground.def: The entity that the Inspector inspects with his senses to ascertain whether it is intact

inspector.def: The person who inspects the Ground to see if it is intact or without blemish

desired_state_of_affairs.def: The desirable state of affairs which the Inspector hopes to find to obtain when inspecting the Ground

purpose.def: Some of the words in this frame occur with a constituent that expresses the desired outcome of the inspection

unwanted_entity.def: An entity whose presence would impair the acceptability or usefulness of the Ground

kissing.def: The words in this frame describe the manipulation of an Entity by an Agent

agent.def: The Agent manipulates an object

entity.def: The Entity being manipulated often occurs as the direct object of verbs:   'Squeeze the ball as many times as you can

bodypart_of_agent.def: The part of the Agent's body being used to manipulate the Entity may also be expressed

place.def: The spatial setting in which the manipulation takes place

photographing.def: A Creator  produces a physical object which is to serve as a Representation of an actual or imagined entity or event, the Represented

represented.def: The entity--which may be a thing, an action or a state--that is represented by the Representation

creator.def: An individual or individuals that bring the Representation into existence

place.def: The location in which the artist produces the representation

blocking.def: In this frame a Hindrance makes it more difficult for a Protagonist to complete their intended Action or a Hindrance directly affects an Action where the Action can be a natural act or the actions of many individuals in a collective endeavor

hindrance.def: The Hindrance is the force which makes the Action more difficult or less likely to be successfully completed

action.def: The Action is what the Protagonist desires to do, which is made more difficult by the Hindrance

protagonist.def: The Protagonist is the entity that tends towards or plans some Action which the Hindrance causes to be more difficult

place.def: The Place is the location where  he Hindrance affects the Protagonist or Action

repairing.def: The Self_mover, a living being, moves under its own direction along a Path

self_mover.def: Self_mover is the living being which moves under its own power

path.def: Path is used for any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor a Goal

area.def: Area is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path

goal.def: Goal is used for any expression which tells where the Self_mover ends up as a result of the motion

direction.def: The direction that the Self_mover heads in during the motion

place.def: The Place is the location within which a defined motion takes place

jogging.def: The Self_mover, a living being, moves under its own direction along a Path

self_mover.def: Self_mover is the living being which moves under its own power

direction.def: The direction that the Self_mover heads in during the motion

hugging.def: This is an abstract frame for acts performed by sentient beings

agent.def: The Agent performs the intentional act

place.def: This FE identifies the place where the intentional act occurs

stretching.def: This frame contains words for motions or actions an Agent performs using some part of his/her body

agent.def: The Agent uses some part of his/her body to perform the action

body_part.def: With some verbs in this frame, the Body_part involved in the action is specified by the meaning of the verb and cannot be expressed separately

place.def: The location within which the movement of a Body_part takes place

engaging.def: This is an abstract frame for acts performed by sentient beings

agent.def: The Agent performs the intentional act

place.def: This FE identifies the place where the intentional act occurs

paddling.def: The words in this frame describe motion involving a Vehicle and someone who controls it, the Driver

driver.def: This is the being, typically human, that controls the Vehicle as it moves

vehicle.def: This is the means of conveyance controlled by the Driver

path.def: Any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor a Goal expresses the frame element Path

area.def: This frame element is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path

goal.def: Any expression which tells where the moving object(s) ends up as a result of the motion expresses the frame element Goal

place.def: The Place describes the location of a more specific motion (which has Source, Path or Goal)

viewing.def: This frame contains perception words whose perceivers intentionally direct their attention to some entity or phenomenon in order to have a perceptual experience

perceiver_agentive.def: The Perceiver_agentive performs some action in order to have a perceptual experience

phenomenon.def: Phenomenon indicates the entity or phenomenon to which the Perceiver_agentive directs his or her attention in order to have a perceptual experience

place.def: The general location within which the act of perception takes place

skating.def: The words in this frame describe motion involving a Vehicle and someone who controls it, the Driver

driver.def: This is the being, typically human, that controls the Vehicle as it moves

vehicle.def: This is the means of conveyance controlled by the Driver

path.def: Any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor a Goal expresses the frame element Path

area.def: This frame element is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path

goal.def: Any expression which tells where the moving object(s) ends up as a result of the motion expresses the frame element Goal

place.def: The Place describes the location of a more specific motion (which has Source, Path or Goal)

clothing.def: The words in this frame refer to what Clothing the Wearer (or a specific Body_part of the Wearer) has on

wearer.def: The person whose clothing is under discussion

clothing.def: This FE identifies the Clothing that the Wearer wears

body_part.def: The body part of the Wearer which is covered by the Clothing

washing.def: These are words relating to filling containers and covering areas with some thing, things or substance, the Theme

goal.def: The Goal is the area or container being filled

theme.def: The Theme is the physical object or substance which changes location

agent.def: The Agent is the actor who instigates the filling

cause.def: An event which brings about the filling of the Goal

place.def: Where the filling takes place

source.def: The Source is the initial location of the Theme, before it changes location

grabbing.def: An Agent removes a Theme from a Source so that the it is in the Agent's possession

agent.def: The person who takes possession of the Theme

theme.def: The Agent takes possession of the Theme

source.def: The location of the Theme prior to the taking

place.def: Where the taking takes place

skinning.def: This frame covers words for Body_part(s) (BP) belonging to a Possessor (Poss), which may be characterized by a Descriptor (Desc)

possessor.def: This Frame Element denotes the Possessor of the Body_part

body_part.def: This Frame Element  is the Body_part

handing.def: A Donor transfers a Theme from a Donor to a Recipient

theme.def: The object that changes ownership

donor.def: The person that begins in possession of the Theme and causes it to be in the possession of the Recipient

recipient.def: The entity that ends up in possession of the Theme

place.def: The Place where the Donor gives the Theme to the Recipient

pouring.def: A Mass_theme, generally made up of many individuals, moves from a Source to a Goal with some Path

mass_theme.def: The mass of entities which moves

goal.def: Goal is the location the Mass_theme ends up in

source.def: The Source is the location the Theme occupies initially before its change of location

area.def: The place where the overall motion event takes place, thus including Source, Path, and Goal locations

path.def: Path refers to (a part of the) ground the Mass_theme travels over or to a landmark the Mass_theme travels by

place.def: The spatial setting in which the Mass_motion takes place

approaching.def: An object Theme moves in the direction of a Goal

theme.def: Theme is the object that moves

goal.def: Goal is any expression that tells where the Theme ends up, or would end up, as a result of the motion

place.def: This FE identifies the Place where the arriving event occurs

creating.def: The Creator creates a new entity, the Created_entity, possibly out of Components

created_entity.def: This FE identifies the entity that the Agent intentionally creates

creator.def: The Creator creates a created entity

place.def: This FE identifies the place ehere the Agent intentionally creates the new entity

shaping.def: This frame contains words which describe the dimensional extent and Shape of a Substance

shape.def: This is the Shape that the Substance is in

substance.def: A Substance of which pieces can be extracted

celebrating.def: A Social_event occurs at which Attendees are present to conduct a social function or joint activity

attendee.def: Attendee is used for the people who come to the Social_event

place.def: This FE identifies the Place where the Social_event occurs

adjusting.def: An Agent changes a Part of a complex entity with regard to some Feature in order to achieve some Imposed_purpose affected by the Feature

agent.def: The individual that controls the value of a Feature

part.def: The part of the complex entity which is changed in the process of adjusting

feature.def: The Feature with respect to which the Part is adjusted

place.def: The location where the adjusting takes place

flipping.def: An Protagonist goes from a default state of mental and emotional equilibrium into a temporary state of disequilibrium, often a state of anger

protagonist.def: This is the person (or people) whose mental state changes

action.def: Something done by the Protagonist as a result of losing mental equilibrium

beginning.def: An Agent initiates the beginning of an ongoing Activity in which he will be continuously involved

activity.def: This FE identifies the Activity that an Agent starts

agent.def: This FE identifies the being that starts the intentional Activity

place.def: This FE identifies the Place where the Agent starts an Activity

biting.def: In this frame a Body_mark is present on a Possessor's body

possessor.def: This Frame Element denotes the Possessor of the Body_mark

starting.def: An Agent initiates the beginning of an ongoing Activity in which he will be continuously involved

activity.def: This FE identifies the Activity that an Agent starts

agent.def: This FE identifies the being that starts the intentional Activity

place.def: This FE identifies the Place where the Agent starts an Activity

direction.def: The direction that the Self_mover heads in during the motion

fishing.def: A Hunter tries to gain Food by way of outsmarting or tracking a living

hunter.def: The Hunter is the agent hoping to obtain Food

ground.def: This is the entity to which the Hunter pays attention

food.def: Food is the sought-out item by the Hunter

place.def: The greater geographic location where the Hunter attempts to obtain Food

attending.def: An Agent goes to an Event and is present in a relatively non-participatory way

event.def: The Event is the deliberate set of happenings given at a particular time and place

agent.def: The  Agent is the person who chooses to make himself present at the Event

place.def: The location where the Agent attends the Event

tossing.def: An Agent causes a Theme to move from a Source, along a Path, to a Goal

agent.def: The Agent is the one whose action causes the motion of a Theme

suspending.def: An Agent pauses in the course of an Activity

activity.def: This FE identifies the Activity for which an Agent is pausing

agent.def: An Agent pauses in the course of an Activity

place.def: This FE identifies the Place where an Agent pauses in the course of an Activity

spraying.def: An Agent or a Cause causes a Fluid to move from a Source to a Goal along a Path or within an Area

fluid.def: The entity that changes location and moves in a fluidic way

agent.def: The animate protagonist who causes the Fluid to move

goal.def: Goal is the location the Fluid ends up in as a result  of the motion  'Why did  you squirt juice onto my chair?'

source.def: The location that the Fluid occupies initially

area.def: The setting in which the Fluid's movement takes place along an unspecified Path

place.def: The location where the motion takes place

phenomenon.def: Phenomenon indicates the entity or phenomenon to which the Perceiver_agentive directs his or her attention in order to have a perceptual experience

agent.def: The Agent engages in an ongoing Activity

activity.def: This FE identifies the name of the ongoing Activity in which an Agent engages

place.def: This FE identifies the Place where the ongoing Activity occurs

student.def: One who is instructed by a Teacher in skills or knowledge

teacher.def: One who instructs a Student in some area of knowledge or skill

skill.def: An action which the Student is able to perform as a result of instruction

subject.def: The area of knowledge or skill which is taught by a Teacher or to a Student

fact.def: A piece of information that the Student is informed of by the Teacher

place.def: The Place is the location within which the teaching takes place

squatting.def: A Protagonist changes the overall position and posture of the body

calling.def: A Speaker uses a particular linguistic form, a Name to refer to an Entity

name.def: The linguistic form used by the Speaker to refer to the Entity

entity.def: The entity that is designated by the Speaker with the Name used

speaker.def: The person who uses the Name  to refer to the Entity

topic.def: Topic expresses the subject that the Interlocutors are trying to come to some agreement about

interlocutors.def: In some sentences both participants are expressed by the Subject, and there is no 'with'-phrase (cf example 1)

interlocutor_1.def: In cases where the Interlocutors involved in a conversation are construed as two separate groups with different levels of volitionality or control, this FE identifies the conversational participant with greater semantic and syntactic prominence, as compared with Interlocutor_2

interlocutor_2.def: In cases where the Interlocutors involved in a conversation are construed as two separate groups with different levels of volitionality or control, Interlocutor_2 refers to the semantically and grammatically less prominent group

searcher.def: The person who is looking all over the Ground for the Sought_entity

ground.def: The location that the Searcher covers in looking for the Sought_entity

sought_entity.def: The entity that the Searcher wants to find

loading.def: Generally without overall (translational) motion,  an Agent places a Theme at a location, the Goal, which is profiled

theme.def: The Theme is the object that changes location during the Placing

goal.def: The FE Goal is the location where the Theme ends up

agent.def: The Agent is the person (or other force) that causes the Theme to move

place.def: The Place indicates where the Placing occurs

direction.def: The direction that the Self_mover heads in during the motion

patient.def: The Patient is the entity which undergoes the change brought about by the Grinder or Grinding_cause

grinder.def: The Grinder breaks the Patient into smaller pieces

place.def: This FE identifies the Place where  the Grinder grinds the Patient

assailant.def: The person (or other self-directed entity) that is attempting physical harm to the Victim

victim.def: This FE is the being or entity that is injured by the Assailant's attack

place.def: This FE identifies the place where the Assailant makes an assault on the Victim

marching.def: The Self_mover, a living being, moves under its own direction along a Path

self_mover.def: Self_mover is the living being which moves under its own power

path.def: Path is used for any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor a Goal

area.def: Area is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path

goal.def: Goal is used for any expression which tells where the Self_mover ends up as a result of the motion

direction.def: The direction that the Self_mover heads in during the motion

place.def: The Place is the location within which a defined motion takes place

embracing.def: An Agent has an Attribute which can take different Values, and the Agent selects and then begins to use some Value for that Attribute

agent.def: The Agent selects a Value for his/her Attribute and begins to use it

value.def: The Value, chosen and made effective by the Agent, specifies the Attribute

place.def: This FE identifies the Place where the Agent has the Attribute which can take different Value

cheering.def: Some phenomenon (the Stimulus) provokes a particular emotion in an Experiencer

experiencer.def: The Experiencer reacts emotionally or psychologically to the Stimulus

stimulus.def: The Stimulus is the event or entity which brings about the emotional or psychological state of the Experiencer

entering.def: An object Theme moves in the direction of a Goal

theme.def: Theme is the object that moves

goal.def: Goal is any expression that tells where the Theme ends up, or would end up, as a result of the motion

place.def: This FE identifies the Place where the arriving event occurs

finishing.def: An Agent finishes an Activity, which can no longer logically continue

activity.def: This FE identifies the Activity that the Agent has finished

agent.def: This FE identifies the Agent who has finished an Activity

place.def: This FE identifies the Place where the Agent finishes the Activity

entertaining.def: An Agent intentionally seeks to bring about an internal mental or emotional state in the Experiencer

experiencer.def: The Experiencer is the person the Agent causes to have a particular emotional state

agent.def: The Agent is an External Argument of the target word and purposefully arouses an emotional state

place.def: This FE identifies the Place where the Agent affects the Experiencer </def-root >

chatting.def: A group of people (the Interlocutors or Interlocutor_1 and Interlocutor_2 together) have a conversation

interlocutors.def: The group of individuals involved in chatting

interlocutor_1.def: The individual or individuals that form the more prominent (i

interlocutor_2.def: The semantically (and grammatically) less prominent group of participants in a conversation

place.def: The location where a chat takes place
